sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A briefe examination, of a certaine peremptorie menacing and disleal petition presented, as is pretended, to the Kings most excellent Maiestie, by certaine laye papistes, calling themselues, the lay Catholikes of England, and now lately printed, and diuulged by a busie compagnion, called Iohn Lecey Sutcliffe, Matthew, 1550?-1629.
[8], 133, 136-146, 145-141 [i.e. 147], [5] p.
Printed [by R. Bradock] for William Cotton, and are to be sold at his shoppe, adioyning to Ludgate, At London : 1606.
A reprinting of and reply to: A petition apologeticall, presented to the Kinges most excellent Majesty, by the lay Catholikes of England, in July last. Printer's name from STC. Running title reads: An answere to the lay papists lame petition. The last leaf is blank. P. 147 misnumbered 141. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
A briefe examination, of a certaine peremptorie menacing and disleal petition presented, as is pretended, to the Kings most excellent Maiestie, by certaine laye papistes, calling themselues, the lay Catholikes of England, and now lately printed, and diuulged by a busie compagnion, called Iohn Lecey Sutcliffe, Matthew, 1550?-1629.
[8], 133, 136-146, 145-141 [i.e. 147], [5] p.
Printed [by R. Bradock] for William Cotton, and are to be sold at his shoppe, adioyning to Ludgate, At London : 1606.
A reprinting of and reply to: A petition apologeticall, presented to the Kinges most excellent Majesty, by the lay Catholikes of England, in July last. Printer's name from STC. Running title reads: An answere to the lay papists lame petition. The last leaf is blank. P. 147 misnumbered 141. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
William Cotton
R. Bradock]
his shoppe, adioyning to Ludgate
